snippet: China and two of its neighbors, Vietnam and India, are fighting over energy exploration in the waterway, a signal that Beijing plans to continue its hard line over the area.
abstract: Dispute flares between China and its neighbors Vietnam and India as Vietnam accuses Chinese fishing boat of cutting seismic cable attached to one of its vessels exploring for oil and gas near the Gulf of Tonkin in South China Sea, act apparently intended to inhibit Vietnam from pursuing energy deposits; Vietnam and India,  which operates several joint ventures with Vietnam’s national energy company Petro Vietnam, say they will send patrols to protect their interests.
lead_paragraph: China and two of its neighbors, Vietnam and India, are fighting over energy exploration in the waterway, a signal that Beijing plans to continue its hard line over the area.

headline.seo: Dispute Flares Over Energy Exploration in South China Sea
headline.main: Dispute Flares Over Energy in South China Sea
headline.print_headline: Dispute Flares Over Energy in South China Sea
